Kniga molitvena, v-steroj sze nahájajo rázlocsne ponizne molitvi, z-dvójim pridavekom, na haszek szlovenszkoga národa sz-pobo'snim sztroskom nikih plemenitih dobrocsinitelov na szvetloszt dána. (1783)

Kniga molitvena, v-steroj sze nahájajo rázlocsne ponizne molitvi, z-dvojim pridavekom. (1796); Knjiga molitvena, v-steroj sze nahajajo rázlocsne ponizne molitvi, z-dvojim pridavekom, na haszek szlovenszkoga národa na szvetloszt dana. (1813, 1821, 1838); Kniga molitvena, v-steroj sze nahajajo rázlocsne ponizne molitvi, z-dvójim pridavekom. Na haszek katolicsánszkim kerscsenikom. (1843, 1846, 1847); Kniga molitvena, v-steroj sze nahajajo razlocsne ponizne molitvi z-dvojnim pridavekom. Na haszek katolicsánszkim krscsenikom znouvics vödána. Zbougsana i z-nikemi lejpimi molitvami, i kejpmi povéksana. Z-pridavkom na 28 lejt szlü'sécsega kalendaria i k-torni szlisajoucsi drügi dugovány. (1853, 1855); Kniga molitvena v-steroj sze nahajajo rázlocsne ponizne molitvi, z-dvójim pridavekom. Na haszek katolicsanszkim krscsenikom. (1853); Kniga molitvena sztaro-szlovenszka. V-steroj sze najdejo razlocsne molitvi, litanie, szv. pesmi za vszako prilozsno potrebcsino, i szv. krizsna pot. Na haszek katolicsánskim krscsenikom. (1864); Molitvena kniga sztároszlovenszka puna odebránih lepih molitev, litanijah, peszem, vu vszákoj dühovnoj potrebcsini kath. kerscsenika, i križna pót. (1868); Kniga molitvena sztaro-szlovenszka. V steroj sze najdejo razlocsne molitvi, litanie, szv. peszmi za vszako prilozsno potrebcsino, i Szv. krizsna pot. Na haszek katolicsanszkim krscsenikom. (1869); Kniga molitvena. Bogábojécsim düsam dána. Sztáro-szlovenszka. (1877, 1891, '1909 or before'); Molitvena kniga. Popravlena sztara szlovenszka 'Kniga molitvena'. (1904, 1907, 1910, 1914 [in 1914 two slightly different editions were published by the same publisher.])

Szombathely (1796); Bad Radkersburg (1813, 1821, 1838, 1843, 1846, 1853, 1864, 1868, 1891, 1904, 1907, 1910, 1914 [in 1914 two slightly different editions were published by the same publisher]); Körmend (1847 [v'Körmendin], 1853); Lendava (1855, 1869); Murska Sobota (1877); Lendava, Murska Sobota ('1909 or before')

Anton Siess (1796); Alois Weitzinger (1813, 1821, 1838, 1843); Jánoš Weitzinger (1846, 1853, 1864, 1868, 1891); Ferencz Udvary (1847, 1853); Endre Balogh (1855); vdova Endre Balogha (1869); M. Ujházi (1877); Franc Semlitsch (1904, 1907, 1910); Ernő Balkanyi ('1909 or before'); vdova Franca Semlitscha (1914 [in 1914, two slightly different editions were published in Radkersburg by the same publisher])

Škafar, Ivan: Bibliografija prekmurskih tiskov od 1715 do 1919 = Bibliographie der Drucke im Dialekt von Prekmurje von 1715 bis 1919. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1978, 19, 21, 24, 25, 28, 29, 30, 31, 36, 37, 38, 41, 43, 44, 52, 59, 70-71, 74, 77, 78, 84; Kokolj, Miroslav; Horvat, Bela: Prekmursko šolstvo od začetka reformacije do zloma nacizma. Murska Sobota, Pomurska založba, 1977, 74; Andoljšek, Ivan: Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana, Univerzum, 1978, 61; Šlebinger, Janko: Küzmič, Mikloš (1738–1804). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi313754/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (27. February 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 4. vol. Kocen - Lužar. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1932; Novak, Vilko: Sakovič, Jožef (1874–1930). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi532595/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (28. February 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 9. vol. Raab - Schmid. Alfonz Gspan et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1960.

The work was reprinted at least 24 times. The editions that were printed from 1904 were revised by Jožef Sakovič. Regarding the school use of the present text, which of course was not primarily intended as a school textbook, Andoljšek writes: 'Knigi molitveni (1783) /…/ were added songs, translated from the official Teresian hymnal, and they represent the beginning of the printed Catholic hymnals of Prekmurje and were used in Catholic schools precisely because of them' (Škafar, 1978, 70-71, 74, 77, 78-79, 84 and Andoljšek, 1978, 61 and Novak, 2013).

div.head: Szlovenszki szilabikár, z-steroga sze decza steti more navcsiti, z-nikimi rejcsniczami navküpe pod prespan stampanya dáni. (1780)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Szlovenszki szilabikár, z-steroga sze decza steti more navcsiti, z-nikimi rejcsniczami navküpe pod prespan stampanya dáni. (1780)

Szlovenszki silabikár, z-steroga sze decza steti more navcsiti, z-nikimi rejcsiczami, i sz-prilósenim krsztsànszkim návukom navkupe, pod prespan stampanya znouvics dani. (1812); [The exact title of the edition published by Alojz Weitzinger in Radgona around 1821, is unknown.]; Abecedar z-steroga sze dêtcza práv szlováriti, takaj csêti navesi poulek vnougoga haszna razuma z-nouvics z-ostampani. (1828); Szlovenszki szilabikár, z-steroga sze decza steti more navcsiti, z-nikimi rejcsiczami, i sz-prilo'senim krsztsanszkim navukom navküpe, pod prespan stampanya znouvics dáni. (1847); Szlovenszki szilabikár, z-steroga sze decza steti more navcsiti, z-nikimi rejcsiczami, sz- prilo'senim krsztsánszkim navukom, pod prespan stampanya znouvics dani. (1851); [The exact title of the edition, which 'had been /…/ printed in 1853 or a little earlier by Ferenc Udvary in Körmend', is unknown.]; Szlovenszki szilabikár, z-steroga sze decza steti more navesiti, z-nikimi rejcsiczami, i sz-prilo'senim krsztsanszkim návukom navküpe, pod prespan stampanya znouvics dani. (1857); Szlovenszki szilabikár, z-steroga sze decza steti more navcsiti. Z-nikimi rejcsiczami, i szprilosenim krsztsánszkim návukom navküpe. Pod prespan stampanya znouvics dani. (1861, 1864, s. d. 'before 1871'); Szlovenszki ABCDÁR, krsztsánszko-katolicsánszki návuk i drugi za malo decsiczo potrebne recsi. (1868); Szlovenszki ABCDAR, krsztsanszko-katolicsanszki navuk i druge za malo decsiczo potrebne recsi. (s. d. 'before 1871', s.d. 'natis okoli 1871'); Krátki krsztsánszki návuk za málo deczo (1895)

[Only indirectly known edition, dated by Škafar to around 1821, was probably published in Bad Radkersburg]; Varaždin (1828); Bad Radkersburg (1812, 1847, 1851, 1861, 1864, s. d. 'before 1871', s.d. 'around 1871'); [Only indirectly known edition, dated by Škafar to around '1853 or before', was probably published in Körmend.]; Lendava (1857, 1868); Szentgotthárd (1895)

Alois Weitzinger (1812, 1847, 1851, 1861, 1864, s. d. 'before 1871', s.d. 'circa 1871'); [Only indirectly known edition, dated by Škafar to around 1821, was probably published by Weitzinger.]; byi János Szangilla (1828); [The only indirectly known edition, which Škafar dates to '1853 or a little earlier', was probably 'printed by /…/ Ferencz Udvary'.]; Endre Balogh (1857, 1868); Béla Wellisch (1895)

Digitalna knjižnica Slovenije - dLib.si: https://www.dlib.si/?URN=URN:NBN:SI:doc-8LM2CAMR; https://www.dlib.si/details/URN:NBN:SI:DOC-RGUVXS5H; https://www.dlib.si/details/URN:NBN:SI:DOC-L5VIJHC0; Google Books: https://books.google.si/books?id=d9xbAAAAcAAJ&pg=PP5#v=onepage&q&f=false;

Škafar, Ivan. Bibliografija prekmurskih tiskov od 1715 do 1919 = Bibliographie der Drucke im Dialekt von Prekmurje von 1715 bis 1919. Ljubljana : Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1978, pp. 17-18, 25, 26, 31, 34, 35-36, 39-40, 41-42, 45-46; Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 61; Kokolj, Miroslav; Horvat, Bela. Prekmursko šolstvo od začetka reformacije do zloma nacizma. Murska Sobota : Pomurska založba, 1977, pp. 74; Šlebinger, Janko: Küzmič, Mikloš (1738–1804). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. https://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi313754/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (27. February 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 4. vol. Kocen - Lužar. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1932.

Before 1871, two editions of the present work, which cannot be precisely dated, were published in Radgona by the same publisher under different titles. Despite the significant change in the title, it is a reworking of the present text by Küzmič, also in the case of the work 'Krátki krsztsánszki návuk za málo deczo' published in 1895. Thus Škafar comments: 'Actually, the fifteenth edition of M. Küzmič's Slovenian syllabary from 1780, only without the alphabet and examples of syllabification /…. - The editor is unknown' (Škafar, 1978, 45-46, 62).

Različica 1.0. https://fran.si/slovnice-in-pravopisi/27/1863-lesar . Zadnja sprememba 10. 6. 2015.

The present text was published in 1863 in the annual report of the Ljubljana Realschule (Jahresbericht der K.k. Unterrealschule in Laibach). As Mitja Trojar points out, the work 'was also used as a separate print' (Trojar, 2015 and Lukman, 2013 and Schmidt, 1988, 355).

In addition to the data from COBISS, Trieste and the printing house of Austrian Lloyd are listed in the table as the place of publication and publisher. div.head: Györszki Kátekismus tou-je-tou: D. Luther Mártonna Máli Kátekismus, z drügimi lejpimi pobo`snimi pítanyami, ino szem szpodobnimi nísterimi molitvami, zdaj znouvics Na Szlovenszko obrnyen, za volo, v-Szlovenszkoj Okroglini L. Solszke Deczé (1796)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor

Györszki Kátekismus tou-je-tou: D. Luther Mártonna Máli Kátekismus, z drügimi lejpimi pobo`snimi pítanyami, ino szem szpodobnimi nísterimi molitvami, zdaj znouvics Na Szlovenszko obrnyen, za volo, v-Szlovenszkoj Okroglini L. Solszke Deczé (1796)

Škafar, Ivan: Bibliografija prekmurskih tiskov od 1715 do 1919 = Bibliographie der Drucke im Dialekt von Prekmurje von 1715 bis 1919. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1978, 15, 21.

As Škafar points out, it is a revised edition of Temlin's work 'Mali katechismus, touje tou krátki návuk vöre kerschánszke' (a translation and adaptation of the 'Hungarian translation of Luther's Small Catechism') from 1715. The author of the present revision is unknown. As the most likely candidate Škafar cites Mihal Bakoš (Škafar, 1978, 15, 21).

Štęvilstvo za slovénske šóle po zes. kralj. dęržávah (1830)

Hladnik, Milan: 'Prvi slovenski matematični učbeniki.' Šolska kronika 26, no. 3 (2017), 313-318.; Schmidt, Vlado: Zgodovina šolstva in pedagogike na Slovenskem II. (1805 - 1848). Ljubljana, Državna založba Slovenije, 1964, 223-224; Kolarič, Rudolf: Metelko, Franc Serafin (1789–1860). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi363425/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (6. February 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 5. vol. Maas - Mrkun. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1933.

Metelko's translation of the German calculus 'Anleitung zur Rechenkunst zum Gebrauche der deutschen Schulen in den kaiserlichen königlichen Staaten. Erster Theil. Für Trivial- und Hauptschulen von drey Classen' was not very widespread in schools with the Slovenian language of instruction. Thus Schmidt comments: 'In one and a half years, only 17 copies were sold, even though first-grade students could also use it. In bilingual schools, they used German calculus, but in Slovenian schools - as in most cases before - due to the predominantly oral calculus, they also published without it, especially since it was printed in the Metelko alphabet' (Hladnik, 2017, 314 in Schmidt, 1964, 223-224).

div.head: Slovensko-nemška začetnica za ljudske šole = Slovenisch-deutsche Fibel für Volksschulen (1881)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Slovensko-nemška začetnica za ljudske šole = Slovenisch-deutsche Fibel für Volksschulen (1881)

Slovenisch-deutsche Fibel für allgemeine Volksschulen = Slovensko-nemška Začetnica za občne ljudske šole (1887, 1889, 1893, 1894); Slovenisch-deutsche Fibel für allgemeine Volksschulen = Slovensko-nemška Začetnica za obče ljudske šole (1896, 1897, 1898, 1900); Slovensko-nemški abecednik za obče ljudske šole = Slovenisch-deutsche Fibel für allgemeine Volksschulen (1907, 1910, 1913)

Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj II (1869-1918). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1976, pp. 44; Verordnungsblatt für den Dienstbereich des Ministeriums für Cultus und Unterricht, no. 14 (1881), pp. 166. https://alex.onb.ac.at/cgi-content/alex?aid=vcu&datum=1881&size=45&page=189 (11. October 2022); Mantuani, Josip: Miklošič, Janez (1823–1901). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. https://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi367651/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (11. October 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 5. vol. Maas - Mrkun. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1933; Simonič, Franc. Slovenska bibliografija. Part 1, Knjige : (1550-1900.). Ljubljana, Slovenska Matica, 1903, pp. 317.

Before 1871, two editions of the present work, which cannot be precisely dated, were published in Bad Radkersburg by the same publisher under different titles. Despite the significant change in the title, it is a reworking of the present text by Küzmič, also in the case of the work Krátki krsztsánszki návuk za málo deczo' published in 1895. Škafar states: 'In reality, the 15th edition of M. Küzmič's Slovenski silabikar from 1780, only without the alphabet and examples of syllabification /…. - The editor is unknown' (Škafar, 1978, 45-46, 62).

div.head: Erstes Lesebuch für den deutschen Sprachunterricht in nicht-deutschen Volksschulen (1861)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Erstes Lesebuch für den deutschen Sprachunterricht in nicht-deutschen Volksschulen (1861)
Erstes Lesebuch für den deutschen Sprachunterricht in nicht-deutschen Volksschulen (1862, 1863, 1868)

Schmidt, Vlado: Zgodovina šolstva in pedagogike na Slovenskem III. (1848-1870). Ljubljana, Delavska enotnost, 1988, 284; Tanja Žigon, Karin Almasy, Andrej Lovšin: Vloga in pomen prevajanja učbenikov v 19. stoletju : kulturnozgodovinski in jezikovni vidiki. Ljubljana, Znanstvena založba Filozofske fakultete, 2017, 103-104; Šlebinger, Janko: Močnik, Franc, vitez (1814–1892). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi372369/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (11. December 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 5. vol. Maas - Mrkun. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1933.

Regarding the diffusion of the work, Schmidt points out that: 'in Carniola /.../ in the first years after publication, the deaneries, which also had a main school on their territory, received barely a few thousand copies of the first German reader per year, i.e., even less than bilingual grammar books, although the reading compositions were supposed to be used as reading exercises for grammar books.' (Schmidt, 1988, 284) Regarding the other authors who were involved in the creation of this and other Močnik's works, see: (Žigon and Almasy and Lovšin, 2017, 103-104).

Schmidt, Vlado: Zgodovina šolstva in pedagogike na Slovenskem III. (1848-1870). Ljubljana, Delavska enotnost, 1988, 284; Tanja Žigon, Karin Almasy, Andrej Lovšin: Vloga in pomen prevajanja učbenikov v 19. stoletju : kulturnozgodovinski in jezikovni vidiki. Ljubljana, Znanstvena založba Filozofske fakultete, 2017, 103-104; Šlebinger, Janko: Močnik, Franc, vitez (1814–1892). Slovenska biografija. Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 5. vol. Maas - Mrkun. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1933.

Regarding the diffusion of the work, Schmidt points out that the work was: 'a rarity even in the major schools (Hauptschulen)'. (Schmidt, 1988, 284) Regarding other authors who were involved in the creation of this and other works by Močnik, see: (Žigon and Almasy and Lovšin, 2017, 103-104).

Ljubljana, Delavska enotnost, 1988, 284-285; Tanja Žigon, Karin Almasy, Andrej Lovšin: Vloga in pomen prevajanja učbenikov v 19. stoletju : kulturnozgodovinski in jezikovni vidiki. Ljubljana, Znanstvena založba Filozofske fakultete, 2017, 103-104; Šlebinger, Janko: Močnik, Franc, vitez (1814–1892). Slovenska biografija. Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 5. vol. Maas - Mrkun. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1933.

Regarding the diffusion of the work, Schmidt points out that: 'They didn't have it at all in Carniola. For a few years, they were also used in the first and second year of the independent Realschule in Trieste.' (Schmidt, 1988, 284-285) Regarding other authors who were involved in the creation of this and other Močnik's works, see: (Žigon and Almasy and Lovšin, 2017, 103-104).

(1835); Krajnski vertnar, ali Poduzhenje, v' kratkim veliko sadnih dreves sarediti, jih s' zeplenjam poshlahtniti, in lepe verte k' velikim pridu sasaditi. II del., Od reje niskiga drevja ali pertlikovzov in posodovzov, in kako perdelano sadje k' pridu obrazhati, de veliko sadene (1834); Krajnski vertnar, ali Poduzhenje, v kratkim veliko sadnih dreves sarediti, jih s zepljenjem poshlahtiti, in lepe verte k velikimu pridu sasaditi (1845); Kranjski vertnar, ali Poduk za umno rejo sadnih dreves (1863)
Ignac Kleinmayr (1834, 1835); Jožef Blaznik (1845); c. k. kmetijska družba na Kranjskem (1863)

Schmidt, Vlado: Zgodovina šolstva in pedagogike na Slovenskem III. (1848-1870). Ljubljana, Delavska enotnost, 1988, 336; Lukman, Franc Ksaver: Pirc, Franc (1785–1880). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi372369/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (18. May 2023). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 5. vol. Maas - Mrkun. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1933.

Regarding the authorship, Schmidt writes that the royalties 'were shared between Blaž Potočnik and Franc Močnik.' The work was intended especially for classes in the fourth grade of the major schools (Hauptschulen) in Carniola. In practice, according to Schmidt, the work was used 'mainly for learning German language' (Schmidt, 1988, 283).

div.head: Slovenski Abecednik za pervi razred ljudskih šol (1869)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Slovenski Abecednik za pervi razred ljudskih šol (1869)
Slovenski Abecednik za pervi razred ljudskih šol (1870, 1871, 1873, 1875, 1877)

Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 252-255; Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj II (1869-1918). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1976, pp. 44, 89. Lukman, Franc Ksaver: Praprotnik, Andrej (1827–1895). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. https://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi455111/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (28. July 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 7. vol. Peterlin - Pregelj C. France Kidrič et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1949.

The textbook was approved by the ministry on October 4, 1868, No. 8204, thus Andoljšek assumes that the textbook was also published in that year (Andoljšek, 1978, 252). However, given the confirmation date, it is quite possible that it was not actually printed until the following year. Neither the edition from 1868 nor 1869 is available in Slovenian libraries. However, since the edition from 1869 (from the Library of Congress) is accessible via the Internet and is not mentioned by Andoljšek or other literature, we assume that it is the same edition, thus we entered 1869 as the first year of its publication.

Prvo berilo in slovnica za slovenske ljudske šole (1885, 1888); Prvo berilo in prva slovnica za drugi razred 4- in 5-razrednih ljudskih šol (1890, 1893); Prvo berilo in prva slovnica za 1-, 2- in 3-razredne ljudske šole (1891); Prvo berilo in prva slovnica za drugi razred štirirazrednih in petrazrednih ljudskih šol (1901); Berilo in slovnica za drugi razred štirirazrednih in petrazrednih ljudskih šol (1902)

Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj II (1869-1918). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1976, pp. 45, 133-135; Kranjec, Silvo: Razinger, Anton (1851–1918). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi491920/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (17. May 2023). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 9. vol. Raab - Schmid. Alfonz Gspan et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1960; Andoljšek, Ivan: Žumer, Andrej (1847–1903). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi910656/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (17. May 2023). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 15. vol. Zdolšek - Žvanut. Jože Munda et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 1991.

Despite the changes in the titles, it is the same textbook, and only a few texts have been added over the years. Andoljšek lists the editions from 1882, 1885, 1890, 1891, 1893, and 1902, but mentions that the literature also mentions the editions of 1887 and 1888. The problem is that in this case the counting of reprints printed in textbooks is incorrect (Andoljšek, 1976, 133 -134). The COBISS system also includes the 1888 edition, which is why it is still included in the list, as well as the unmentioned 1901 edition.

Strictly speaking, of course, it is not a school textbook. Nevertheless, the present text was used in practice by high school professors until 1850. In the present review, therefore, we only list the editions that were published until 1850. The work was published in 1854 (Schmidt, 1988, 92, 109).

Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 1991; Verordnungsblatt für den Dienstbereich des Ministeriums für Cultus und Unterricht, no. 23 (1882), 226. https://alex.onb.ac.at/cgi-content/alex?aid=vcu&datum=1882&size=45&page=250 (6. May 2023).

Aleksander Rožek is the author of the German original. The present work is a translation of the fourth edition of Rožko's work Wörterbuch zu Hoffmanns Historia antiqua und Caesar de bello gallico, which, according to Hriberšek, was prepared by a group of 'five high school professors' (Hriberšek, 2005, 151).

It is a textbook that has been approved for the teaching of the Slovenian language in educational institutions with the German language as language of instruction. The work was republished in 1920. In the editions from 1913 and 1920, Štefan Podboj also participated along with Sket (Koblar, 2013 and Capuder, 2013).

In its entirety, the textbook was published only twice (1854 and 1868) and several times in parts: I. Dogodivščina svete vere (Ks. Kosar), II. Navod pobožnega življenja in lepega zadržanja (according to bishop Bernard Galur, Felicijan Globočnik), III. Spisovanje listov (Matia Majer), IV. Številoslovje (supposedly S. according to Krajnc's draft), V. Vodba modrega kmetovanja (Peter Musi), VI. Vinoreja (Anton Koderman), VII. Zemljopis (Jožef Drobnič), VIII. Ljubezen do domovine (Slomšek) (Andoljšek, 1978, 270).

Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 259-264; Grafenauer, I., Gspan, A.: Slomšek, Anton Martin (1800–1862). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. https://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi584693/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (25. July 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 10. vol. Schmidl - Steklasa. Alfonz Gspan et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1967; Lukman, Franc Ksaver: Rozman, Jožef (1801–1871). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi522412/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (16. May 2023). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 9. vol. Raab - Schmid. Alfonz Gspan et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1960; Karin Almasy, Kanon und nationale Konsolidierung. Übersetzungen und ideologische Steuerung in slowenischen Schullesebüchern (1848–1918), pp. 264-265, 390. Wien: Böhlau, 2018, https://library.oapen.org/handle/20.500.12657/25718;

Both Cobiss and dLib.si attribute the authorship to Jožef Rozman, which Andoljšek as well as Ivan Grafenauer and Alfonz Gspan (Grafenauer and Gspan, 2013) reject. The author of the work is said to be Slomšek (Andoljšek, 1978, 259). At the same time, Almasy points out that Rozman was then a young seminarian who was part of Slomšek's circle. Slomšek was supposed to take over the editing and final design, leaving the writing mainly to younger people (Almasy, 2018, 390).

Andoljšek points out that the work was probably published 'before December 15, 1868, but perhaps with the year 1869 /.../.' Simonič (and after him Andoljšek) points out that the work was published in three variants: 'with black images, colored images; with added reading' (Andoljšek, 1978, 255 and Simonič, 1903, 529).

Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor

Kmetijska kemija, to je, Natorne postave in kemijske resnice obernjene na človeško in živalsko življenje, na kmetijstvo in njegove pridelke (1856)

Schmidt, Vlado: Zgodovina šolstva in pedagogike na Slovenskem III. (1848-1870). Ljubljana, Delavska enotnost, 1988, 92, 336; Adamič, France: Vertovec, Matija (1784–1851). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi777566/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (5. December 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 13. vol. Trubar - Vodaine. Alfonz Gspan, Jože Munda in Fran Petrè Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1982.

Strictly speaking, the work is not a textbook, but it nevertheless also served as lessons for schoolchildren. Bakoš himself recommended the work for such use in the preface (Kokolj and Horvat, 1977, 92). In addition, the work was also considered in agriculture lessons in review schools (Schmidt, 1988, 92, 336).

div.head: Nouvi zákon ali Testamentom goszpodna nasega Jezusa Krisztusa zdaj oprvics z grcskoga na sztári szlovenszki jezik obrnyeni po Stevan Küzmicsi Surdánszkom F. (1771)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Nouvi zákon ali Testamentom goszpodna nasega Jezusa Krisztusa zdaj oprvics z grcskoga na sztári szlovenszki jezik obrnyeni po Stevan Küzmicsi Surdánszkom F. (1771)

Nouvi zákon ali Testamentom goszpodna nasega Jezusa Krisztusa zdaj oprvics z grcskoga na sztári szlovenszki jezik obrnyeni po Stevan Küzmicsi Surdánszkom F. (1817); Nôvi zákon ali Testamentom Goszpodna nasega Jezusa Krisztusa zdaj oprvics zGrcskoga na sztári Szlovenszki jezik obrnyeni po Küzmics Stevani surdánszkom farari. i Knige 'zoltárszke (1848); Nôvi zakon ali testamentom goszpodna nasega Jezus Krisztusa. Szlovencseni po Küzmics Stevani surdanszkom dühovniki. (1883)
Belanijevi dediči (1817); Reichard Károl i szinovi (1848); Britanska biblična družba (1883)

Škafar, Ivan: Bibliografija prekmurskih tiskov od 1715 do 1919 = Bibliographie der Drucke im Dialekt von Prekmurje von 1715 bis 1919. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1978, 17, 24, 32, 54-55; Kokolj, Miroslav; Horvat, Bela: Prekmursko šolstvo od začetka reformacije do zloma nacizma. Murska Sobota, Pomurska založba, 1977, 122; Šlebinger, Janko: Küzmič, Mikloš (1738–1804). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi313754/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (2. March 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 4. vol. Kocen - Lužar. Franc Ksaver Lukman et al. Ljubljana, Zadružna gospodarska banka, 1932; Novak, Vilko: Terplan, Aleksander (1816–1858). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi694102/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (3. March 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 12. vol. Táborská - Trtnik. Alfonz Gspan, Fran Petrè et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1980; Novak, Vilko: Torkoš, Jožef (1710–1791). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi715056/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (3. March 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 12. vol. Táborská - Trtnik. Alfonz Gspan, Fran Petrè et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1980.

The translation of the New Testament is the work of Mikloš Küzmič. As Škafar notes, the editions from 1848 and 1883 were 'linguistically edited by Aleksander Terplan'. Terplan's translation of the Psalms is also added to the latter. Only the first edition contains also a comprehensive foreword by Jožef Torkoš. As Kokolj and Hrovat point out, the present text was used as a reader in schools. The work was published in 1928 (Škafar, 1978, 17, 24, 32, 54-55 and Kokolj and Horvat, 1977, 122 and Šlebinger, 2013 and Novak, 2013 and Novak, 2013).

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor

Kershanski katolshki nauk sa male shóle na kmétih, vsét is vélikiga katekisma, sapovédaniga po z. k. Estrajshkih dershavah (1835, 1840, 1843, 1844, 1847)
Schmidt, Vlado: Zgodovina šolstva in pedagogike na Slovenskem. II. Part (1805 - 1848). Ljubljana, DZS, 1964, 204.

Regarding the authorship of the present work, Schmidt writes: 'The first part of the small reader (catechism) was translated by Ravnikar in 1819, but it was published as a primary school book in Carniola only in 1834 under the title 'Keršanski katolški nauk za male šole na kmetih...' in 'Zaloga šolskih knjig na Dunaju' (Schmidt, 1964, 204).

Digitalna knjižnica Slovenije - dLib.si: https://www.dlib.si/details/URN:NBN:SI:DOC-1Z1TW4HD; Google Books: https://books.google.si/books?id=9-fs5B1maZQC&hl=sl&pg=PP1#v=onepage&q&f=false

Glaser, Karel: Zgodovina slovenskega slovstva. III. volume: Bleiweisova dôba od 1848. do 1870. leta. Ljubljana, Slovenska Matica, 1896, pp. 271. http://www.dlib.si/?URN=URN:NBN:SI:DOC-RJVRYIT1 (22. March 2023); Smolik, Marijan: Zamejic, Andrej (1824–1907). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi855715/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (5. May 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 14. vol. Vode - Zdešar. Jože Munda et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 1986; Verordnungsblatt für den Dienstbereich des Ministeriums für Cultus und Unterricht, no. 11 (1890), 170. https://alex.onb.ac.at/cgi-content/alex?aid=vcu&datum=1890&size=45&page=203 (6. April 2023).

The compiler of the present work was Andrej Zamejic. From 1889, the standard version coexisted and was published simultaneously with a substantially more comprehensive revised edition; the latter was published in 1889, 1890, 1893 and 1896. Both versions were approved and at the same time allowed for use in school classes. In the present entry, we combine both (Smolik, 2013).

div.head: Mali katekizem (1880)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Mali katekizem (1881, 1886, 1887, 1890, 1894, 1896); Mali katekizem za ljudske šole (1889)
C. kr. založba šolskih knjig (1881, 1886, 1887, 1889 [standard and revised edition], 1890, 1894, 1896 [revised edition])

Verordnungsblatt für den Dienstbereich des Ministeriums für Cultus und Unterricht, no. 11 (1890), 170. https://alex.onb.ac.at/cgi-content/alex?aid=vcu&datum=1890&size=45&page=203 (6. April 2023); Verordnungsblatt für den Dienstbereich des Ministeriums für Cultus und Unterricht, no. 12 (1896), 315. https://alex.onb.ac.at/cgi-content/alex?aid=vcu&datum=1896&size=45&page=349 (6. April 2023).

Given that the work is listed in the list of approved textbooks for elementary schools (Volksschulen) as early as 1878, there are certainly earlier prints, but we have not been able to identify them so far. From 1889, the standard version coexisted and was published simultaneously with a more extensive revised edition, the latter was published at least in 1889. In 1896, a slightly shorter 'revised edition' was published. All variants were approved and simultaneously approved for use in school lessons.

Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 66; Ilešič, Fran. O pouku slovenskega jezika : njega dosedanje smeri in bodoča naloga. V Ljubljani : Slovenska Šolska Matica, 1902, pp. 25.

Andoljšek did not review the work, and only mentions it indirectly. Considering that the title is very similar and the publisher is the same, it is probably not impossible that it is an earlier version of Debevec's work. However, the two parts differ significantly in the number of pages. As the work has not yet been digitized, I cannot verify this for the time being. In any event, the work kept in the library of the National Museum of Slovenia will have to be reviewed.

div.head: Abezednik sa shóle na kmétih, v' zesar. kralj. dershavah (1834)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Abezednik sa shóle na kmétih, v' zesar. kralj. dershavah (1834)
Abezednik sa shóle na kmétih, v' zesar. kralj. dershavah (1835, 1837, 1842, 1845); Abecednik za šóle na kmétih (1850)
Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 166.
Andoljšek notes that it is a 'translation of Marchner's Alphabet.' The 1842 edition is in Bohorič alphabet, whereas the 1850 edition is in Gaj's Latin Alphabet (Andoljšek, 1978, 166).

div.head: Abecednik za šole na kmétih (1850)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Digitalna knjižnica Slovenije - dLib.si: https://www.dlib.si/?URN=urn:nbn:si:doc-z4q034nu; Zgodovina Slovenije - SIstory: https://hdl.handle.net/11686/51396
Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 166.

Andoljšek notes that it is a 'translation of Marchner's Alphabet.' The Trieste 1850 edition differs slightly from the two Vienna editions. It also contains a brief explanation of the differences between Gaj's Latin Alphabet and Bohorič Alphabet, however minor differences can also be found in the language. Andoljšek states: 'While in the Vienna editions the words have suffixes -om, -ega, -ik, in the Trieste edition they have suffixes -am, -iga, -ek' (Andoljšek, 1978, 166). The second edition has an extended first part (alphabet and basic grammar, while the texts do not differ). Both versions are digitized.

Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 227-237; Grafenauer, I., Gspan, A.: Slomšek, Anton Martin (1800–1862). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. https://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi584693/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (25. July 2022). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 10. vol. Schmidl - Steklasa. Alfonz Gspan et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1967.

Andoljšek notes that: 'The alphabet for Slovenian schools is only slightly reworked Krajnc's 'Blaže'; it was reworked according to Slomšek's instructions by Janez Krajnc; after Slomšek's intervention with Thun, it was bought by Viennese Drž. založba šolskih knjig; Slomšek changed its title' (Andoljšek, 1978, 230).

div.head: Male povéşti : sa méstine shole po zesarskih kraljévih deshélah = Kleine Erzählungen zum Gebrauche der Stadtschulen in den kaiserl. königl. Staaten (1816)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Male povéşti : sa méstine shole po zesarskih kraljévih deshélah = Kleine Erzählungen zum Gebrauche der Stadtschulen in den kaiserl. königl. Staaten (1816)
Male povéşti : sa méstine shole po zesarskih kraljévih deshélah = Kleine Erzählungen zum Gebrauche der Stadtschulen in den kaiserl. königl. Staaten (1826, 1835, 1837, 1844, 1845, 1848)
Janez Jurij Licht (1826); C. kr. založba šolskih knjig (1835, 1837, 1844, 1845, 1848)

Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 192-193, 277; Snoj, A., Uršič, M.: Ravnikar, Matevž (1776–1845). Slovenska biografija. Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, Znanstvenoraziskovalni center SAZU, 2013. http://www.slovenska-biografija.si/oseba/sbi490933/#slovenski-biografski-leksikon (16. May 2023). Originally published in: Slovenski biografski leksikon: 9. vol. Raab - Schmid. Alfonz Gspan et al. Ljubljana, Slovenska akademija znanosti in umetnosti, 1960.

It is a repeatedly translated/adapted German reader 'Kleine Erzählungen zum Gebrauche der Landschulen in den kaiserl. königl. Staaten' which was translated by Matevž Ravnikar as Male povesti, Janez Debevec as Majhine perpovedanja, Štefan Kociančič as Povestice za pervo začetno šolo (Andoljšek, 1978, 277), and Jurij Alič as Kratke povésti. Debevec's translation served as the basis for Ravnikar's. Two different readers were published, 'Male povésti : sa şhole na kmétih po zesarskih kraljévih deshélah' and 'Male povéşti : sa méstine shole po zesarskih kraljévih deshélah.' Andoljšek believes that there are almost no significant differences in content between the two editions, and he considers the two titles out of place (Andoljšek, 1978, 192). Andoljšek does not mention the Viennese editions.

div.head: ABC bukvize sa Slovenze : taku dobru sa te odsrashene, koker te maihine otroke : kateri se brati navuzhiti shelijo (1810)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
ABC bukvize sa Slovenze : taku dobru sa te odsrashene, koker te maihine otroke : kateri se brati navuzhiti shelijo (1810)
Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 137-138.

Regarding the nature of the present work, Andoljšek writes: 'The unofficial ABC bukvice (1810) are only a slightly corrected plateltaf (reader) from Felbiger's era. The booklet contains 10 pages of the alphabet, 20 pages of religious reading only, and on page 31 there is a multiplication table 1 to 10' (Andoljšek, 1978, 137).

div.head: Nov popravleni plateltaf ali Bukve teh zherk inu besedi : sa usse kateri sé ozhjo Krajnsku brâti is fundamenta vuzhiti (between 1787 and 1814)

Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor

Nov popravlieni plateltaf ali Bukve teh zherk inu besedi : sa usse kateri se ozhjo Krajnsku brati is fundamenta vuzhiti (18--)
Andoljšek, Ivan. Naš začetni bralni pouk in učbeniki zanj I (1550-1869). Ljubljana : Univerzum, 1978, pp. 138.

In connection with it and its relationship with Debevč's text, Andoljšek writes: 'Probably before 1814, the Slovenian unofficial Nov popravleni plateltaf or bekve teh cherk inu worde was published by Jožef Merzinger in Maribor. /.../ 'Nov popravleni plateltaf' is almost just like Debevec's 'Nov popravleni plateltaf' from 1794, only that it is linguistically different and contains a lot of printing errors' (Andoljšek, 1978, 138).

div.head: Perva nemška slovnica za slovenske ljudske šole = Erstes deutsches Sprach- und Lesebuch für slovenische Volksschulen (1871)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Perva nemška slovnica za slovenske ljudske šole = Erstes deutsches Sprach- und Lesebuch für slovenische Volksschulen (1871)

Perva nemška slovnica za slovenske ljudske šole = Erstes deutsches Sprach- und Lesebuch für slovenische Volksschulen (1875, 1877, 1879); Perva nemška slovnica za ljudske šole = Erstes deutsches Sprach- und Lesebuch für slovenische Volksschulen (1881, 1882, 1883, 1884); Perva nemška slovnica za občne ljudske šole (1886, 1889); Prva nemška slovnica za občne ljudske šole (1892, 1895)

Zgodovina Slovenije - SIstory: http://hdl.handle.net/11686/49331; Digitalna knjižnica Slovenije dLib.si; https://www.dlib.si/details/URN:NBN:SI:DOC-3QRUNXDE; https://www.dlib.si/details/URN:NBN:SI:DOC-MWWXKQ2R; https://www.dlib.si/details/URN:NBN:SI:DOC-KF5T3ZDJ; https://www.dlib.si/details/URN:NBN:SI:DOC-YR2XJMNF

Schmidt, Vlado: Zgodovina šolstva in pedagogike na Slovenskem III. (1848-1870). Ljubljana, Delavska enotnost, 1988, 285; Verordnungsblatt für den Dienstbereich des Ministeriums für Cultus und Unterricht, no. 11 (1887), 126. https://alex.onb.ac.at/cgi-content/alex?aid=vcu&datum=1887&size=45&page=150 (6. May 2023).

Vlado Schmidt places the first edition in 1868, but we have not been able to find a copy of the book. COBISS lists editions from 1871, 1875, 1877, 1879, 1881, 1882, 1883, 1884, 1886, 1889. A comparison of the digitized editions (1871 and 1879) shows that there were significant content changes in the newer editions. But considering that they were all published by the same publisher and in the same location, it can still be concluded that it is the same textbook.

div.head: Navk sa ludi na kmetih, tistim shivlenje odtéti, katiri so se zadushili, vtonili, smersnili, obésli ali sadavli, katiri so strup vshili, od strele pobiti in pre sgodaj rojeni (1817)

row.cell: Original author (if it is an adaptation) / Author (if it is an original work)
Author of the adaptation / Translator / Editor
Navk sa ludi na kmetih, tistim shivlenje odtéti, katiri so se zadushili, vtonili, smersnili, obésli ali sadavli, katiri so strup vshili, od strele pobiti in pre sgodaj rojeni (1817)
Schmidt, Vlado: Zgodovina šolstva in pedagogike na Slovenskem II. (1805 - 1848). Ljubljana, Državna založba Slovenije, 1964, 212-213.

Schmidt emphasizes that the work was mainly intended for practical lessons for the rural youth. It is therefore not a textbook, yet at times such works were recommended for school use (Schmidt, 1964, 212-213).
